summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330). The parties agree that two documents (3505-043 and 3505-044) are true and accurate copies of a deposition transcript from December 4, 2009, taken in West Palm Beach, Florida, and that this stipulation (marked as Government Exhibit 1007) may be received as evidence at trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case S2 20 CR 330. The stipulation is filed on her behalf by her attorneys.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who, along with Assistant U.S. Attorneys, represents the government in this stipulation.

events.title: Deposition in West Palm Beach
events.description: A deposition was taken on this date in West Palm Beach, Florida. The transcript of this deposition is referenced as documents 3505-043 and 3505-044.

events.title: Filing of Stipulation
events.description: The stipulation agreeing to the authenticity of the 2009 deposition transcript and its admissibility as evidence (Exhibit 1007) was filed in November 2021.

keyFacts: The document is a court stipulation from November 2021 in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330).
The parties stipulate that two documents (3505-043 and 3505-044) are true and accurate copies of a deposition transcript from December 4, 2009, taken in West Palm Beach, Florida.
The stipulation itself is marked as Government Exhibit 1007 and is agreed to be admissible as evidence at trial.
Ghislaine Maxwell is represented by attorneys Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim.
The United States is represented by U.S. Attorney Damian Williams and Assistant U.S. Attorneys.
